_VERSION.description: A global variable (not a function) that holds a string containing the running Lua version. The current value of this variable is "Lua 5.3".

assert.description: Calls error if the value of its argument v is false (i.e., nil or false); otherwise, returns all its arguments. In case of error, message is the error object; when absent, it defaults to "assertion failed!"

collectgarbage.description: This function is a generic interface to the garbage collector. It performs different functions according to its first argument, opt:

error.description: Terminates the last protected function called and returns message as the error object. Function error never returns.

getmetatable.description: If object does not have a metatable, returns nil. Otherwise, if the object's metatable has a __metatable field, returns the associated value. Otherwise, returns the metatable of the given object.

ipairs.description: Returns three values (an iterator function, the table t, and 0) so that the construction

loadfile.description: Similar to load, but gets the chunk from file filename or from the standard input, if no file name is given.

next.description: Allows a program to traverse all fields of a table. Its first argument is a table and its second argument is an index in this table. next returns the next index of the table and its associated value. When called with nil as its second argument, next returns an initial index and its associated value. When called with the last index, or with nil in an empty table, next returns nil. If the second argument is absent, then it is interpreted as nil. In particular, you can use next(t) to check whether a table is empty.

pairs.description: If t has a metamethod __pairs, calls it with t as argument and returns the first three results from the call.

pcall.description: Calls function f with the given arguments in protected mode. This means that any error inside f is not propagated; instead, pcall catches the error and returns a status code. Its first result is the status code (a boolean), which is true if the call succeeds without errors. In such case, pcall also returns all results from the call, after this first result. In case of any error, pcall returns false plus the error message.

print.description: Receives any number of arguments and prints their values to stdout, using the tostring function to convert each argument to a string. print is not intended for formatted output, but only as a quick way to show a value, for instance for debugging. For complete control over the output, use string.format and io.write.

rawequal.description: Checks whether v1 is equal to v2, without invoking the __eq metamethod. Returns a boolean.

rawget.description: Gets the real value of table[index], without invoking the __index metamethod. table must be a table; index may be any value.

rawlen.description: Returns the length of the object v, which must be a table or a string, without invoking the __len metamethod. Returns an integer.

rawset.description: Sets the real value of table[index] to value, without invoking the __newindex metamethod. table must be a table, index any value different from nil and NaN, and value any Lua value.

require.description: Loads the given module. The function starts by looking into the package.loaded table to determine whether modname is already loaded. If it is, then require returns the value stored at package.loaded[modname]. Otherwise, it tries to find a loader for the module.

select.description: If index is a number, returns all arguments after argument number index; a negative number indexes from the end (-1 is the last argument). Otherwise, index must be the string "#", and select returns the total number of extra arguments it received.

setmetatable.description: Sets the metatable for the given table. (To change the metatable of other types from Lua code, you must use the debug library (§6.10).) If metatable is nil, removes the metatable of the given table. If the original metatable has a __metatable field, raises an error.

tonumber.description: When called with no base, tonumber tries to convert its argument to a number. If the argument is already a number or a string convertible to a number, then tonumber returns this number; otherwise, it returns nil.

tostring.description: Receives a value of any type and converts it to a string in a human-readable format. (For complete control of how numbers are converted, use string.format.)

type.description: Returns the type of its only argument, coded as a string. The possible results of this function are "nil" (a string, not the value nil), "number", "string", "boolean", "table", "function", "thread", and "userdata".

xpcall.description: This function is similar to pcall, except that it sets a new message handler msgh.

coroutine.description: This library comprises the operations to manipulate coroutines, which come inside the table coroutine. See §2.6 for a general description of coroutines.

create.description: Creates a new coroutine, with body f. f must be a function. Returns this new coroutine, an object with type "thread".

isyieldable.description: Returns true when the running coroutine can yield.

resume.description: Starts or continues the execution of coroutine co. The first time you resume a coroutine, it starts running its body. The values val1, ... are passed as the arguments to the body function. If the coroutine has yielded, resume restarts it; the values val1, ... are passed as the results from the yield.

running.description: Returns the running coroutine plus a boolean, true when the running coroutine is the main one.

status.description: Returns the status of coroutine co, as a string: "running", if the coroutine is running (that is, it called status); "suspended", if the coroutine is suspended in a call to yield, or if it has not started running yet; "normal" if the coroutine is active but not running (that is, it has resumed another coroutine); and "dead" if the coroutine has finished its body function, or if it has stopped with an error.

wrap.description: Creates a new coroutine, with body f. f must be a function. Returns a function that resumes the coroutine each time it is called. Any arguments passed to the function behave as the extra arguments to resume. Returns the same values returned by resume, except the first boolean. In case of error, propagates the error.

yield.description: Suspends the execution of the calling coroutine. Any arguments to yield are passed as extra results to resume.

math.description: This library provides basic mathematical functions. It provides all its functions and constants inside the table math. Functions with the annotation "integer/float" give integer results for integer arguments and float results for float (or mixed) arguments. Rounding functions (math.ceil, math.floor, and math.modf) return an integer when the result fits in the range of an integer, or a float otherwise.

abs.description: Returns the absolute value of x. (integer/float)

acos.description: Returns the arc cosine of x (in radians).

asin.description: Returns the arc sine of x (in radians).

atan.description: Returns the arc tangent of y/x (in radians), but uses the signs of both parameters to find the quadrant of the result. (It also handles correctly the case of x being zero.)

ceil.description: Returns the smallest integral value larger than or equal to x.

cos.description: Returns the cosine of x (assumed to be in radians).

deg.description: Converts the angle x from radians to degrees.

exp.description: Returns the value ex (where e is the base of natural logarithms).

floor.description: Returns the largest integral value smaller than or equal to x.

fmod.description: Returns the remainder of the division of x by y that rounds the quotient towards zero. (integer/float)

huge.description: The float value HUGE_VAL, a value larger than any other numeric value.

log.description: Returns the logarithm of x in the given base. The default for base is e (so that the function returns the natural logarithm of x).

max.description: Returns the argument with the maximum value, according to the Lua operator <. (integer/float)

maxinteger.description: An integer with the maximum value for an integer.

min.description: Returns the argument with the minimum value, according to the Lua operator <. (integer/float)

mininteger.description: An integer with the minimum value for an integer.

modf.description: Returns the integral part of x and the fractional part of x. Its second result is always a float.

rad.description: Converts the angle x from degrees to radians.

random.description: When called without arguments, returns a pseudo-random float with uniform distribution in the range [0,1). When called with two integers m and n, math.random returns a pseudo-random integer with uniform distribution in the range [m, n]. (The value n-m cannot be negative and must fit in a Lua integer.) The call math.random(n) is equivalent to math.random(1,n).

randomseed.description: Sets x as the "seed" for the pseudo-random generator: equal seeds produce equal sequences of numbers.

sin.description: Returns the sine of x (assumed to be in radians).

sqrt.description: Returns the square root of x. (You can also use the expression x^0.5 to compute this value.)

tan.description: Returns the tangent of x (assumed to be in radians).

tointeger.description: If the value x is convertible to an integer, returns that integer. Otherwise, returns nil.

type.description: Returns "integer" if x is an integer, "float" if it is a float, or nil if x is not a number.

ult.description: Returns a boolean, true if integer m is below integer n when they are compared as unsigned integers.

os.description: This library is implemented through table os.

clock.description: Returns an approximation of the amount in seconds of CPU time used by the program.

date.description: Returns a string or a table containing date and time, formatted according to the given string format.

difftime.description: Returns the difference, in seconds, from time t1 to time t2 (where the times are values returned by os.time). In POSIX, Windows, and some other systems, this value is exactly t2-t1.

execute.description: This function is equivalent to the ISO C function system. It passes command to be executed by an operating system shell. Its first result is true if the command terminated successfully, or nil otherwise. After this first result the function returns a string plus a number, as follows:

exit.description: Calls the ISO C function exit to terminate the host program. If code is true, the returned status is EXIT_SUCCESS; if code is false, the returned status is EXIT_FAILURE; if code is a number, the returned status is this number. The default value for code is true.

getenv.description: Returns the value of the process environment variable varname, or nil if the variable is not defined.

remove.description: Deletes the file (or empty directory, on POSIX systems) with the given name. If this function fails, it returns nil, plus a string describing the error and the error code.

rename.description: Renames file or directory named oldname to newname. If this function fails, it returns nil, plus a string describing the error and the error code.

setlocale.description: Sets the current locale of the program. locale is a system-dependent string specifying a locale; category is an optional string describing which category to change: "all", "collate", "ctype", "monetary", "numeric", or "time"; the default category is "all". The function returns the name of the new locale, or nil if the request cannot be honored.

time.description: Returns the current time when called without arguments, or a time representing the local date and time specified by the given table. This table must have fields year, month, and day, and may have fields hour (default is 12), min (default is 0), sec (default is 0), and isdst (default is nil). Other fields are ignored. For a description of these fields, see the os.date function.

tmpname.description: Returns a string with a file name that can be used for a temporary file. The file must be explicitly opened before its use and explicitly removed when no longer needed.

package.description: The package library provides basic facilities for loading modules in Lua. It exports one function directly in the global environment: require. Everything else is exported in a table package.

config.description: A string describing some compile-time configurations for packages. This string is a sequence of lines:

cpath.description: The path used by require to search for a C loader.

loaded.description: A table used by require to control which modules are already loaded. When you require a module modname and package.loaded[modname] is not false, require simply returns the value stored there.

loadlib.description: Dynamically links the host program with the C library libname.

path.description: The path used by require to search for a Lua loader.

preload.description: A table to store loaders for specific modules (see require).

searchers.description: A table used by require to control how to load modules.

searchpath.description: Searches for the given name in the given path.

string.description: This library provides generic functions for string manipulation, such as finding and extracting substrings, and pattern matching. When indexing a string in Lua, the first character is at position 1 (not at 0, as in C). Indices are allowed to be negative and are interpreted as indexing backwards, from the end of the string. Thus, the last character is at position -1, and so on.

byte.description: Returns the internal numeric codes of the characters s[i], s[i+1], ..., s[j]. The default value for i is 1; the default value for j is i. These indices are corrected following the same rules of function string.sub.

char.description: Receives zero or more integers. Returns a string with length equal to the number of arguments, in which each character has the internal numeric code equal to its corresponding argument.

dump.description: Returns a string containing a binary representation (a binary chunk) of the given function, so that a later load on this string returns a copy of the function (but with new upvalues). If strip is a true value, the binary representation may not include all debug information about the function, to save space.

find.description: Looks for the first match of pattern (see §6.4.1) in the string s. If it finds a match, then find returns the indices of s where this occurrence starts and ends; otherwise, it returns nil. A third, optional numeric argument init specifies where to start the search; its default value is 1 and can be negative. A value of true as a fourth, optional argument plain turns off the pattern matching facilities, so the function does a plain "find substring" operation, with no characters in pattern being considered magic. Note that if plain is given, then init must be given as well.

format.description: Returns a formatted version of its variable number of arguments following the description given in its first argument (which must be a string). The format string follows the same rules as the ISO C function sprintf. The only differences are that the options/modifiers *, h, L, l, n, and p are not supported and that there is an extra option, q.

gmatch.description: Returns an iterator function that, each time it is called, returns the next captures from pattern (see §6.4.1) over the string s. If pattern specifies no captures, then the whole match is produced in each call.

gsub.description: Returns a copy of s in which all (or the first n, if given) occurrences of the pattern (see §6.4.1) have been replaced by a replacement string specified by repl, which can be a string, a table, or a function. gsub also returns, as its second value, the total number of matches that occurred. The name gsub comes from Global SUBstitution.

len.description: Receives a string and returns its length. The empty string "" has length 0. Embedded zeros are counted, so "a\000bc\000" has length 5.

lower.description: Receives a string and returns a copy of this string with all uppercase letters changed to lowercase. All other characters are left unchanged. The definition of what an uppercase letter is depends on the current locale.

match.description: Looks for the first match of pattern (see §6.4.1) in the string s. If it finds one, then match returns the captures from the pattern; otherwise it returns nil. If pattern specifies no captures, then the whole match is returned. A third, optional numeric argument init specifies where to start the search; its default value is 1 and can be negative.

pack.description: Returns a binary string containing the values v1, v2, etc. packed (that is, serialized in binary form) according to the format string fmt (see §6.4.2).

packsize.description: Returns the size of a string resulting from string.pack with the given format. The format string cannot have the variable-length options 's' or 'z' (see §6.4.2).

rep.description: Returns a string that is the concatenation of n copies of the string s separated by the string sep. The default value for sep is the empty string (that is, no separator). Returns the empty string if n is not positive.

reverse.description: Returns a string that is the string s reversed.

sub.description: Returns the substring of s that starts at i and continues until j; i and j can be negative. If j is absent, then it is assumed to be equal to -1 (which is the same as the string length). In particular, the call string.sub(s,1,j) returns a prefix of s with length j, and string.sub(s, -i) returns a suffix of s with length i.

unpack.description: Returns the values packed in string s (see string.pack) according to the format string fmt (see §6.4.2). An optional pos marks where to start reading in s (default is 1). After the read values, this function also returns the index of the first unread byte in s.

upper.description: Receives a string and returns a copy of this string with all lowercase letters changed to uppercase. All other characters are left unchanged. The definition of what a lowercase letter is depends on the current locale.

table.description: This library provides generic functions for table manipulation. It provides all its functions inside the table table.

concat.description: Given a list where all elements are strings or numbers, returns the string list[i]..sep..list[i+1] ··· sep..list[j]. The default value for sep is the empty string, the default for i is 1, and the default for j is #list. If i is greater than j, returns the empty string.

insert.description: Inserts element value at position pos in list, shifting up the elements list[pos], list[pos+1], ···, list[#list]. The default value for pos is #list+1, so that a call table.insert(t,x) inserts x at the end of list t.

move.description: Moves elements from table a1 to table a2, performing the equivalent to the following multiple assignment: a2[t],··· = a1[f],···,a1[e]. The default for a2 is a1. The destination range can overlap with the source range. The number of elements to be moved must fit in a Lua integer.

pack.description: Returns a new table with all parameters stored into keys 1, 2, etc. and with a field "n" with the total number of parameters. Note that the resulting table may not be a sequence.

remove.description: Removes from list the element at position pos, returning the value of the removed element. When pos is an integer between 1 and #list, it shifts down the elements list[pos+1], list[pos+2], ···, list[#list] and erases element list[#list]; The index pos can also be 0 when #list is 0, or #list + 1; in those cases, the function erases the element list[pos].

sort.description: Sorts list elements in a given order, in-place, from list[1] to list[#list]. If comp is given, then it must be a function that receives two list elements and returns true when the first element must come before the second in the final order (so that, after the sort, i < j implies not comp(list[j],list[i])). If comp is not given, then the standard Lua operator < is used instead.

unpack.description: Returns the elements from the given list. This function is equivalent to

utf8.description: This library provides basic support for UTF-8 encoding. It provides all its functions inside the table utf8. This library does not provide any support for Unicode other than the handling of the encoding. Any operation that needs the meaning of a character, such as character classification, is outside its scope.

char.description: Receives zero or more integers, converts each one to its corresponding UTF-8 byte sequence and returns a string with the concatenation of all these sequences.

charpattern.description:
`"[%z\x01-\x7F\xC2-\xF4][\x80-\xBF]*"`

The pattern (a string, not a function) "[\0-\x7F\xC2-\xF4][\x80-\xBF]*" (see §6.4.1), which matches exactly one UTF-8 byte sequence, assuming that the subject is a valid UTF-8 string.

codepoint.description: Returns the codepoints (as integers) from all characters in s that start between byte position i and j (both included). The default for i is 1 and for j is i. It raises an error if it meets any invalid byte sequence.

codes.description: Returns values so that the construction

len.description: Returns the number of UTF-8 characters in string s that start between positions i and j (both inclusive). The default for i is 1 and for j is -1. If it finds any invalid byte sequence, returns a false value plus the position of the first invalid byte.

offset.description: Returns the position (in bytes) where the encoding of the n-th character of s (counting from position i) starts. A negative n gets characters before position i. The default for i is 1 when n is non-negative and #s + 1 otherwise, so that utf8.offset(s, -n) gets the offset of the n-th character from the end of the string. If the specified character is neither in the subject nor right after its end, the function returns nil.

activeItem.description: The activeItem table contains bindings which provide functionality for the ActiveItem and for the item's 'owner' (a ToolUser entity currently holding the item).

ownerEntityId.description: Returns the entity id of the owner entity.

ownerTeam.description: Returns the damage team of the owner entity.

ownerAimPosition.description: Returns the world aim position of the owner entity.

ownerPowerMultiplier.description: Returns the power multiplier of the owner entity.

fireMode.description: Returns the current fire mode of the item, which can be "none", "primary" or "alt". Single-handed items held in the off hand will receive right click as "primary" rather than "alt".

hand.description: Returns the name of the hand that the item is currently held in, which can be "primary" or "alt".

handPosition.description: Takes an input position (defaults to [0, 0]) relative to the item and returns a position relative to the owner entity.

aimAngleAndDirection.description: Returns a table containing the `float` aim angle and `int` facing direction that would be used for the item to aim at the specified target position with the specified vertical offset. This takes into account the position of the shoulder, distance of the hand from the body, and a lot of other complex factors and should be used to control aimable weapons or tools based on the owner's aim position.

aimAngle.description: Similar to activeItem.aimAngleAndDirection but only returns the aim angle that would be calculated with the entity's current facing direction. Necessary if, for example, an item needs to aim behind the owner.

setHoldingItem.description: Sets whether the owner is visually holding the item.

setBackArmFrame.description: Sets the arm image frame that the item should use when held behind the player, or clears it to the default rotation arm frame if no frame is specified.

setFrontArmFrame.description: Sets the arm image frame that the item should use when held in front of the player, or clears it to the default rotation arm frame if no frame is specified.

setTwoHandedGrip.description: Sets whether the item should be visually held with both hands. Does not alter the functional handedness requirement of the item.

setRecoil.description: Sets whether the item is in a recoil state, which will translate both the item and the arm holding it slightly toward the back of the character.

setOutsideOfHand.description: Sets whether the item should be visually rendered outside the owner's hand. Items outside of the hand will be rendered in front of the arm when held in front and behind the arm when held behind.

setArmAngle.description: Sets the angle to which the owner's arm holding the item should be rotated.

setFacingDirection.description: Sets the item's requested facing direction, which controls the owner's facing. Positive direction values will face right while negative values will face left. If the owner holds two items which request opposing facing directions, the direction requested by the item in the primary hand will take precedence.

setDamageSources.description: Sets a list of active damage sources with coordinates relative to the owner's position or clears them if unspecified.

setItemDamageSources.description: Sets a list of active damage sources with coordinates relative to the item's hand position or clears them if unspecified.

setShieldPolys.description: Sets a list of active shield polygons with coordinates relative to the owner's position or clears them if unspecified.

setItemShieldPolys.description: Sets a list of active shield polygons with coordinates relative to the item's hand position or clears them if unspecified.

setForceRegions.description: Sets a list of active physics force regions with coordinates relative to the owner's position or clears them if unspecified.

setItemForceRegions.description: Sets a list of active physics force regions with coordinates relative to the item's hand position or clears them if unspecified.

setCursor.description: Sets the item's overriding cursor image or clears it if unspecified.

setScriptedAnimationParameter.description: Sets a parameter to be used by the item's scripted animator.

setInventoryIcon.description: Sets the inventory icon of the item.

setInstanceValue.description: Sets an instance value (parameter) of the item.

callOtherHandScript.description: Attempts to call the specified function name with the specified argument values in the context of an ActiveItem held in the opposing hand and synchronously returns the result if successful.

interact.description: Triggers an interact action on the owner as if they had initiated an interaction and the result had returned the specified interaction type and configuration. Can be used to e.g. open GUI windows normally triggered by player interaction with entities.

emote.description: Triggers the owner to perform the specified emote.

setCameraFocusEntity.description: If the owner is a player, sets that player's camera to be centered on the position of the specified entity, or recenters the camera on the player's position if no entity id is specified.

activeItemAnimation.description: The activeItemAnimation table contains bindings available to client-side animation scripts for active items.

ownerPosition.description: Returns the current entity position of the item's owner.

ownerAimPosition.description: Returns the current world aim position of the item's owner.

ownerArmAngle.description: Returns the current angle of the arm holding the item.

ownerFacingDirection.description: Returns the current facing direction of the item's owner. Will return 1 for right or -1 for left.

handPosition.description: Takes an input position (defaults to [0, 0]) relative to the item and returns a position relative to the owner entity.

partPoint.description: Returns a transformation of the specified `Vec2F` parameter configured on the specified animation part, relative to the owner's position.

partPoly.description: Returns a transformation of the specified `PolyF` parameter configured on the specified animation part, relative to the owner's position.

mcontroller.description:
The `mcontroller` table sometimes contains functions relating to the actor movement controller.

This section of mcontroller documentation refers to the ActorMovementController lua bindings. There is other documentation referring to the mcontroller table for base MovementControllers.

Usable in scripts related to:
* monsters
* npcs
* tech
* companion system scripts
* status effects
* quest scripts
* active items
* projectiles
* vehicles

parameters.description:
`only works in vehile and projectile scripts`

Returns a table containing the movement parameters for the movement controller.

force.description:
`only works in vehile and projectile scripts`

Accelerates the movement controller by (force / mass) for one tick.

applyParameters.description:
`only works in vehile and projectile scripts`

Applies the given parameters to the movement controller. The provided parameters are merged into the current movement parameters.

resetParameters.description:
`only works in vehile and projectile scripts`

Resets movement parameters to their original state.

boundBox.description: Returns a rect containing the entire collision of the movement controller, in local coordinates.

collisionPoly.description: Returns the collision poly of the movement controller, in local coordinates.

collisionBody.description: Returns the collision poly of the movement controller, in world coordinates.

collisionBoundBox.description:
`only works in vehile and projectile scripts`

Returns a rect containing the entire collision poly of the movement controller, in world coordinates.

localBoundBox.description:
`only works in vehile and projectile scripts`

Returns a rect containing the entire collision of the movement controller, in local coordinates.

mass.description: Returns the configured mass of the movement controller.

position.description: Returns the current position of the movement controller.

xPosition.description: Returns the current horizontal position of the movement controller.

yPosition.description: Returns the current vertical position of the movement controller.

velocity.description: Returns the current velocity of the movement controller.

xVelocity.description: Returns the current horizontal velocity of the movement controller.

yVelocity.description: Returns the current vertical velocity of the movement controller.

rotation.description: Returns the current rotation of the movement controller in radians.

isColliding.description: Returns whether the movement controller is currently colliding with world geometry or a PhysicsMovingCollision.

isNullColliding.description: Returns whether the movement controller is currently colliding with null world geometry. Null collision occurs in unloaded sectors.

isCollisionStuck.description: Returns whether the movement controller is currently stuck colliding. Movement controllers can stick if the `stickyCollision` movement parameter is set.

stickingDirection.description: Returns the angle that the movement controller is currently stuck at, in radians.

liquidPercentage.description: Returns the percentage of the collision poly currently submerged in liquid.

liquidId.description: Returns the liquid ID of the liquid that the movement controller is currently submerged in. If this is several liquids this returns the most plentiful one.

onGround.description: Returns whether the movement controller is currently on ground.

zeroG.description: Returns `true` if the movement controller is at a world position without gravity or if gravity has been disabled.

atWorldLimit.description: Returns `true` if the movement controller is touching the bottom or the top (unless bottomOnly is specified) of the world.

setAnchorState.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Anchors the movement controller to an anchorable entity at the given anchor index.

resetAnchorState.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Reset the anchor state.

anchorState.description: Returns ID of anchored entity and index of the anchor position.

setPosition.description: Sets the position of the movement controller.

setXPosition.description: Sets the horizontal position of the movement controller.

setYPosition.description: Sets the vertical position of the movement controller.

translate.description: Moves the movement controller by the vector provided.

setVelocity.description: Sets the velocity of the movement controller.

setXVelocity.description: Sets the horizontal velocity of the movement controller.

setYVelocity.description: Sets the vertical velocity of the movement controller.

addMomentum.description: Adds (momentum / mass) velocity to the movement controller.

setRotation.description: Sets the rotation of the movement controller. Angle is in radians.

baseParameters.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Returns the base movement parameters.

walking.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Returns whether the actor movement controller is currently walking.

running.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Returns whether the actor movement controller is currently running.

movingDirection.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Returns the direction that the actor movement controller is currently moving in. -1 for left, 1 for right.

facingDirection.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Returns the facing direction. -1 for left, 1 for right.

crouching.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Returns whether the controller is currently crouching.

flying.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Returns whether the controller is currently flying.

falling.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Returns whether the controller is currently falling.

canJump.description: Returns whether the controller can currently jump.

jumping.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Returns whether the controller is currently jumping.

groundMovement.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Returns whether the controller is currently in a ground movement state. Movement controllers can be in ground movement even when onGround returns false.

liquidMovement.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Returns whether the controller is currently in liquid movement state. Movement controllers can be in ground movement even when onGround returns false.

controlRotation.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Rotates the controller. Each control adds to the previous one.

controlAcceleration.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Rotates the controller. Each control adds to the previous one.

controlForce.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Controls force. Each control adds to the previous one.

controlApproachVelocity.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Approaches the targetVelocity using the force provided. If the current velocity is higher than the provided targetVelocity, the targetVelocity will still be approached, effectively slowing down the entity.

Each control overrides the previous one.

controlApproachVelocityAlongAngle.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Approaches the targetVelocity but only along the provided angle, not affecting velocity in the perpendicular axis. If positiveOnly, then it will not slow down the movementController if it is already moving faster than targetVelocity.

Each control overrides the previous one.

controlApproachXVelocity.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Approaches an X velocity. Same as using approachVelocityAlongAngle with angle 0.

Each control overrides the previous one.

controlApproachYVelocity.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Approaches a Y velocity. Same as using approachVelocityAlongAngle with angle (Pi / 2).

Each control overrides the previous one.

controlParameters.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Changes movement parameters. Parameters are merged into the base parameters.

Each control overrides the previous one.

controlModifiers.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Changes movement modifiers. Modifiers are merged into the base modifiers.

Each control overrides the previous one.

controlMove.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Controls movement in a direction.

Each control overrides the previous one.

controlFace.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Controls the facing direction.

Each control overrides the previous one.

controlDown.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Controls dropping through platforms.

Each control overrides the previous one.

controlCrouch.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Controls crouching.

Each control overrides the previous one.

controlJump.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Controls starting a jump. Only has an effect if canJump is true.

Each control overrides the previous one.

controlHoldJump.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Keeps holding jump. Will not trigger a new jump, and can be held in the air.

Each control overrides the previous one.

controlFly.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Keeps holding jump. Will not trigger a new jump, and can be held in the air.

Each control overrides the previous one.

autoClearControls.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Returns whether the controller is currently set to auto clear controls before each script update.

setAutoClearControls.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Set whether to automatically clear controls before each script update.

clearControls.description:
`doesn't work in vehile and projectile scripts`

Manually clear all controls.

config.description: The `config` lua bindings relate to anything that has a configuration and needs to access configuration parameters.

getParameter.description: Returns the value for the specified config parameter. If there is no value set, returns the default.

CommandProcessor.description: The command processor has a single binding for performing admin checks, available on the *CommandProcessor* table.

adminCheck.description: Checks whether the specified connection id is authorized to perform admin actions and returns `nil` if authorization is succesful. If unauthorized, returns a `String` error message to display to the client requesting the action, which may include the specified action description, such as "Insufficient privileges to do the time warp again."

animator.description:
The *animator* table contains functions that relate to an attached networked animator.

Networked animators are found in:
* tech
* monsters
* vehicles
* status effects
* active items

setAnimationState.description: Sets an animation state. If startNew is true, restart the animation loop if it's already active. Returns whether the state was set.

animationState.description: Returns the current state for a state type.

animationStateProperty.description: Returns the value of the specified property for a state type.

setGlobalTag.description: Sets a global animator tag. A global tag replaces any tag <tagName> with the specified tagValue across all animation parts.

setPartTag.description: Sets a local animator tag. A part tag replaces any tag <tagName> with the specified tagValue in the partType animation part only.

setFlipped.description: Sets whether the animator should be flipped horizontally.

setAnimationRate.description: Sets the animation rate of the animator.

rotateGroup.description:
Rotates a rotation group to the specified angle. If immediate, ignore rotation speed.

*NOTE:* Rotation groups have largely been replaced by transformation groups and should only be used in a context where maintaining a rotation speed is important. When possible use transformation groups.

currentRotationAngle.description: Returns the current angle for a rotation group.

hasTransformationGroup.description: Returns whether the animator contains the specified transformation group.

rotateTransformationGroup.description: Rotates the specified transformation group by the specified angle in radians, optionally around the specified center point.

scaleTransformationGroup.description: Scales the specified transformation group by the specified scale. Optionally scale it from a scaleCenter.

transformTransformationGroup.description:
Applies a custom Mat3 transform to the specified transformationGroup. The applied matrix will be:  
```
[ a , b , tx
, c , d , ty
, 0 , 0 , 1 ]
```

resetTransformationGroup.description:
Resets a transformationGroup to the identity transform.  
```
[ 1 , 0 , 0 , 
  0 , 1 , 0 , 
  0 , 1 , 1 ]
```

setParticleEmitterActive.description: Sets a particle emitter to be active or inactive.

setParticleEmitterEmissionRate.description: Sets the rate at which a particle emitter emits particles while active.

setParticleEmitterBurstCount.description: Sets the amount of each particle the emitter will emit when using burstParticleEmitter.

setParticleEmitterOffsetRegion.description: Sets an offset region for the particle emitter. Any particles spawned will have a randomized offset within the region added to their position.

burstParticleEmitter.description: Spawns the entire set of particles `burstCount` times, where `burstCount` can be configured in the animator or set by setParticleEmitterBurstCount.

setLightActive.description: Sets a light to be active/inactive.

setLightPosition.description: Sets the position of a light.

setLightColor.description: Sets the color of a light. Brighter color gives a higher light intensity.

setLightPointAngle.description: Sets the angle of a pointLight.

hasSound.description: Returns whether the animator has a sound by the name of `soundName`

setSoundPool.description: Sets the list of sound assets to pick from when playing a sound.

setSoundPosition.description: Sets the position that a sound is played at.

playSound.description: Plays a sound. Optionally loop `loops` times. 0 plays the sound once (no loops), -1 loops indefinitely.

setSoundVolume.description: Sets the volume of a sound. Optionally smoothly transition the volume over `rampTime` seconds.

stopAllSounds.description: Stops all instances of the specified sound.

setEffectActive.description: Sets a configured effect to be active/inactive.

partPoint.description: Returns a `Vec2F` configured in a part's properties with all of the part's transformations applied to it.

partPoly.description: Returns a `PolyF` configured in a part's properties with all the part's transformations applied to it.

partProperty.description: Returns an animation part property without applying any transformations.

transformPoint.description: Applies the specified part's transformation on the given point.

transformPoly.description: Applies the specified part's transformation on the given poly.

message.description:
The message table contains a single function, setHandler, which allows entities to receive messages sent using world.sendEntityMessage. Entities which can receive messages include:  
* monster
* NPC
* object
* vehicle
* stagehand
* projectile

Additionally, messages can be handled by a variety of script contexts that run on the player:  
* activeitem
* quest
* playercompanions
* status

setHandler.description:
Note on the handler:  
It's a function that must at least have 2 arguments, but to be honest they are useless, naming them _ is a perfectly valiud way of writing the header  
Example:  
```lua
function(messageName,isLocal,arg1,arg2, args ...)
	--your handler code
end
```

Messages of the specified message type received by this script context will call the specified function. The first two arguments passed to the handler function will be the `String` messageName and a `bool` indicating whether the message is from a local entity, followed by any arguments sent with the message.

pane.description: These pane bindings are available to container interface panes and include functions not specifically related to widgets within the pane.

containerEntityId.description:
`Only works in container panes`

Returns the entity id of the container that this pane is connected to.

playerEntityId.description:
`Only works in container panes`

Returns the entity id of the player that opened this pane.

sourceEntity.description: Returns the entity id of the pane's source entity.

playSound.description: Plays the specified sound asset, optionally looping the specified number of times or at the specified volume.

stopAllSounds.description: Stops all instances of the given sound asset, and returns `true` if any sounds were stopped and `false` otherwise.

setTitle.description: Sets the window title and subtitle.

addWidget.description: Creates a new widget with the specified config and adds it to the pane, optionally with the specified name.

removeWidget.description: Removes the specified widget from the pane.

item.description: The `item` table is available in all scripted items and contains functions relating to the item itself.

name.description: Returns the name of the item.

count.description: Returns the stack count of the item.

setCount.description: Sets the item count. Returns any overflow.

maxStack.description: Returns the max number of this item that will fit in a stack.

matches.description: Returns whether the item matches the specified item. If exactMatch is `true` then both the item type and parameters must match, otherwise the items are more loosely matched using the item's internal matchingDescriptors.

matchingDescriptors.description: Returns the list of matching descriptors.

consume.description: Consumes items from the stack. Returns whether the full count was successfuly consumed.

empty.description: Returns whether the item stack is empty.

descriptor.description: Returns an item's descriptor for the item.

description.description: Returns the description for the item.

friendlyName.description: Returns the short description for the item.

rarity.description:
Returns the rarity for the item.

* 0 = common
* 1 = uncommon
* 2 = rare
* 3 = legendary
* 4 = essential

rarityString.description: Returns the rarity as a string.

iconDrawables.description: Returns a list of the item's icon drawables.

dropDrawables.description: Returns a list of the item's itemdrop drawables.

largeImage.description: Returns the item's configured large image, if any.

twoHanded.description: Returns whether the item is two handed.

timeToLive.description: Returns the items's time to live.

learnBlueprintsOnPickup.description: Returns a list of the blueprints learned on picking up this item.

hasItemTag.description: Returns whether the set of item tags for this item contains the specified tag.

pickupQuestTemplates.description: Returns a list of quests acquired on picking up this item.

physics.description: The physics table is available to objects and used to control any collisions or force regions configured on those objects.

setForceEnabled.description: Enables or disables the specified physics force region.

setCollisionPosition.description: Moves the specified physics collision region to the specified position.

setCollisionEnabled.description: Enables or disables the specified physics collision region.

tech.description: The `tech` table contains functions exclusively available in tech scripts.

aimPosition.description: Returns the current cursor aim position.

setVisible.description: Sets whether the tech should be visible.

setParentState.description:
Set the animation state of the player.

Valid states:  
* "Stand"
* "Fly"
* "Fall"
* "Sit"
* "Lay"
* "Duck"
* "Walk"
* "Run"
* "Swim"

setParentDirectives.description: Sets the image processing directives for the player.

setParentHidden.description: Sets whether to make the player invisible. Will still show the tech.

setParentOffset.description: Sets the position of the player relative to the tech.

parentLounging.description: Returns whether the player is lounging.

setToolUsageSuppressed.description: Sets whether to suppress tool usage on the player. When tool usage is suppressed no items can be used.

localAnimator.description: The *localAnimator* table provides bindings used by client side animation scripts (e.g. on objects and active items) to set drawables/lights and perform rendering actions.

playAudio.description: Immediately plays the specified sound, optionally with the specified loop count and volume.

spawnParticle.description: Immediately spawns a particle with the specified name or configuration at the specified position.

addDrawable.description:
Adds the specified drawable to the animator's list of drawables to be rendered. If a render layer is specified, this drawable will be drawn on that layer instead of the parent entity's render layer. Drawables set in this way are retained between script ticks and must be cleared manually using localAnimator.clearDrawables().

The drawable object must specify exactly one of the following keys to define its type:

* [`pair<Vec2F, Vec2F>` __line__] - Defines this drawable as a line between the specified two points.
* [`List<Vec2F>` __poly__] - Defines the drawable as a polygon composed of the specified points.
* [`string` __image__] - Defines the drawable as an image with the specified asset path.

The following additional keys may be specified for any drawable type:

* [`Vec2F` __position__] - Relative position of the drawable.
* [`Color` __color__] - Color for the drawable. Defaults to white.
* [`bool` __fullbright__] - Specifies whether the drawable is fullbright (ignores world lighting).

The following additional key may be specified for line drawables:

* [`float` __width__] - Specifies the width of the line to be rendered.

The following transformation options may be specified for image drawables. Note that if a __transformation__ is specified, it will be used instead of other specific transformation operations.

* [`Mat3F` __transformation__]
* [`bool` __centered__]
* [`float` __rotation__]
* [`bool` __mirrored__]
* [`float` __scale__]

clearDrawables.description: Clears the list of drawables to be rendered.

name.description:
Adds the specified light source to the animator's list of light sources to be rendered. Light sources set in this way are retained between script ticks and must be cleared manually using localAnimator.clearLightSources(). The configuration object for the light source accepts the following keys:

* `Vec2F` __position__
* `Color` __color__
* [`bool` __pointLight__]
* [`float` __pointBeam__]
* [`float` __beamAngle__]
* [`float` __beamAmbience__]

clearLightSources.description: Clears the list of light sources to be rendered.

getParameter.description: Returns the value for the specified object parameter. If there is no value set, returns the default.

direction.description: Returns the object's facing direction. This will be 1 for right or -1 for left.

script.description: Most entity script contexts include the *script* table, which provides bindings for getting and setting the script's update rate. Update deltas are specified in numbers of frames, so a script with an update delta of 1 would run every frame, or a script with an update delta of 60 would run once per second. An update delta of 0 means that the script's periodic update will never be called, but it can still perform actions through script calls, messaging, or event hooks.

updateDt.description: Returns the duration in seconds between periodic updates to the script.

stagehand.description: The stagehand table contains bindings specific to stagehands which are available in addition to their common tables.

id.description: Returns the stagehand's entity id. Identical to entity.id(), so use that instead.

position.description: Returns the stagehand's position. This is identical to entity.position(), so use that instead.

setPosition.description: Moves the stagehand to the specified position.

setUniqueId.description: Sets the stagehand's unique entity id, or clears it if unspecified.

projectile.description: The projectile table contains bindings specific to projectiles which are available in addition to their common tables.

getParameter.description: Returns the value for the specified config parameter. If there is no value set, returns the default.

sourceEntity.description: Returns the entity id of the projectile's source entity, or `nil` if no source entity is set.

timeToLive.description: Returns the projectile's current remaining time to live.

setTimeToLive.description: Sets the projectile's current remaining time to live. Altering the time to live may cause visual disparity between the projectile's master and slave entities.

collision.description: Returns `true` if the projectile has collided and `false` otherwise.

processAction.description: Immediately performs the specified action. Action should be specified in a format identical to a single entry in e.g. actionOnReap in the projectile's configuration. This function will not properly perform rendering actions as they will not be networked.

setReferenceVelocity.description: Sets the projectile's reference velocity (a base velocity to which movement is relative)

entity.description:
The *entity* table contains functions that are common among all entities. Every function refers to the entity the script context is running on.

Accessible in:

* companion system scripts
* quests
* tech
* primary status script
* status effects
* monsters
* npcs
* objects

id.description: Returns the id number of the entity.

damageTeam.description: Returns a table of the entity's damage team type and team number. Ex: ``{type = "enemy", team = 0}``

isValidTarget.description: Returns whether the provided entity is a valid target of the current entity. An entity is a valid target if they can be damaged, and in the case of monsters and NPCs if they are aggressive.

distanceToEntity.description: Returns the vector distance from the current entity to the provided entity.

entityInSight.description: Returns whether the provided entity is in line of sight of the current entity.

position.description: Returns the position of the current entity.

entityType.description: Returns the  type of the current entity.

uniqueId.description: Returns the unique ID of the entity. Returns nil if there is no unique ID.

persistent.description: Returns `true` if the entity is persistent (will be saved to disk on sector unload) or `false` otherwise.

playerCompanions.description: The playerCompanions table contains bindings used to manage player companions such as pets and crew members.

getCompanions.description: Returns a list of configurations for all companions of the specified type.

setCompanions.description: Sets the player's companions of the specified type to the specified list of companion configurations.

animationConfig.description:
The `animationConfig` table contains functions for getting configuration options from the base entity and its networked animator.

It is available only in client side rendering scripts.

animationParameter.description: Returns a networked value set by the parent entity's master script.

partPoint.description: Returns a `Vec2F` configured in a part's properties with all of the part's transformations applied to it.

partPoly.description: Returns a `PolyF` configured in a part's properties with all the part's transformations applied to it.

effect.description: The `effect` table relates to functions specifically for status effects.

duration.description: Returns the remaining duration of the status effect.

modifyDuration.description: Adds the specified duration to the current remaining duration.

expire.description: Immediately expire the effect, setting the duration to 0.

sourceEntity.description: Returns the source entity id of the status effect, if any.

setParentDirectives.description: Sets image processing directives for the entity the status effect is active on.

getParameter.description: Returns the value associated with the parameter name in the effect configuration. If no value is set, returns the default specified.

addStatModifierGroup.description:
Adds a new stat modifier group and returns the ID created for the group. Stat modifier groups will stay active until the effect expires.

Stat modifiers are of the format:

```lua
{
  stat = "health",

  amount = 50
  --OR baseMultiplier = 1.5
  --OR effectiveMultiplier = 1.5
}
```

setStatModifierGroup.description: Replaces the list of stat modifiers in a group with the specified modifiers.

removeStatModifierGroup.description: Removes the specified stat modifier group.

celestial.description:
The *celestial* table contains functions that relate to the client sky, flying the player ship, system positions for planets, system objects, and the celestial database.

It is available in the following contexts:  
* script pane

skyFlying.description: Returns whether the client sky is currently flying.

skyFlyingType.description: Returns the type of flying the client sky is currently performing.

skyWarpPhase.description: Returns the current warp phase of the client sky, if warping.

skyWarpProgress.description: Returns a value between 0 and 1 for how far through warping the sky is currently.

skyInHyperspace.description: Returns whether the sky is currently under hyperspace flight.

flyShip.description:
Flies the player ship to the specified SystemLocation in the specified system.

SystemLocation is either of the following types: Null, CelestialCoordinate, Object, Vec2F

The locations are specified as a pair of type and value

```lua
local system = celestial.currentSystem().location
local location = nil -- Null
location = {"coordinate", {location = system, planet = 1, satellite = 0}} -- CelestialCoordinate
location = {"object", "11112222333344445555666677778888"} -- Object (UUID)
location = {0.0, 0.0} -- Vec2F (position in space)
celestial.flyShip(system, location)
```

flying.description: Returns whether the player ship is flying.

shipSystemPosition.description: Returns the current position of the ship in the system.

shipDestination.description: Returns the current destination of the player ship.

shipLocation.description: Returns the current system location of the player ship.

currentSystem.description: Returns the CelestialCoordinate for system the ship is currently in.

planetSize.description: Returns the diameter of the specified planet in system space.

planetPosition.description: Returns the position of the specified planet in system space.

planetParameters.description: Returns the celestial parameters for the specified planet.

visitableParameters.description: Returns the visitable parameters for the specified visitable planet. For unvisitable planets, returns nil.

planetName.description: Returns the name of the specified planet.

planetSeed.description: Returns the seed for the specified planet.

clusterSize.description: Returns the diameter of the specified planet and its orbiting moons.

planetOres.description: Returns a list of ores available on the specified planet.

systemPosition.description: Returns the position of the specified location in the *current system*.

orbitPosition.description:
Returns the calculated position of the provided orbit.

```lua
local orbit = {
    target = planet, -- the orbit target
    direction = 1, -- orbit direction
    enterTime = 0, -- time the orbit was entered, universe epoch time
    enterPosition = {1, 0} -- the position that the orbit was entered at, relative to the target
}
```

systemObjects.description: Returns a list of the Uuids for objects in the current system.

objectType.description: Returns the type of the specified object.

variants.description: Returns the parameters for the specified object.
Returns the children for the specified celestial coordinate. For systems, return planets, for planets, return moons.

objectWarpActionWorld.description: Returns the warp action world ID for the specified object.

objectOrbit.description: Returns the orbit of the specified object, if any.

objectPosition.description: Returns the orbit of the specified object, if any.

objectTypeConfig.description: Returns the configuration of the specified object type.

hasChildren.description: Returns definitively whether the coordinate has orbiting children. nil return means the coordinate is not loaded.

childOrbits.description: Returns the child orbits for the specified celestial coordinate.

playerShips.description: Returns a list of the player ships in the current system.

playerShipPosition.description: Returns the position of the specified player ship.

scanSystems.description: Returns a list of systems in the given region. If includedTypes is specified, this will return only systems whose typeName parameter is included in the set. This scans for systems asynchronously, meaning it may not return all systems if they have not been generated or sent to the client. Use scanRegionFullyLoaded to see if this is the case.

scanConstellationLines.description: Returns the constellation lines for the specified universe region.

scanRegionFullyLoaded.description: Returns whether the specified universe region has been fully loaded.

centralBodyImages.description: Returns the images with scales for the central body (star) for the specified system coordinate.

planetaryObjectImages.description: Returns the smallImages with scales for the specified planet or moon.

worldImages.description: Returns the generated world images with scales for the specified planet or moon.

starImages.description: Returns the star image for the specified system. Requires a twinkle time to provide the correct image frame.

status.description:
The `status` table relates to the status controller attached to an entity. It is available in:

* monsters
* npcs
* interfaces
* status effects
* companion system scripts
* quest scripts
* tech
* primary status scripts for: player, monster, npc

statusProperty.description: Returns the value assigned to the specified status property. If there is no value set, returns default.

setStatusProperty.description: Sets a status property to the specified value.

stat.description: Returns the value for the specified stat. Defaults to 0.0 if the stat does not exist.

statPositive.description: Returns whether the stat value is greater than 0.

resourceNames.description: Returns a list of the names of all the configured resources.

isResource.description: Returns whether the specified resource exists in this status controller.

resource.description: Returns the value of the specified resource.

resourcePositive.description: Returns whether the value of the specified resource is greater than 0.

setResource.description: Sets a resource to the specified value.

modifyResource.description: Adds the specified value to a resource.

giveResource.description: Adds the specified value to a resource. Returns any overflow.

consumeResource.description: Tries to consume the specified amount from a resource. Returns whether the full amount was able to be consumes. Does not modify the resource if unable to consume the full amount.

overConsumeResource.description: Tries to consume the specified amount from a resource. If unable to consume the full amount, will consume all the remaining amount. Returns whether it was able to consume any at all of the resource.

resourceLocked.description: Returns whether the resource is currently locked.

resetResource.description: Resets a resource to its base value.

resetAllResources.description: Resets all resources to their base values.

resourceMax.description: Returns the max value for the specified resource.

resourcePercentage.description: Returns the percentage of max that the resource is currently at. From 0.0 to 1.0.

setResourcePercentage.description: Sets a resource to a percentage of the max value for the resource. From 0.0 to 1.0.

modifyResourcePercentage.description: Adds a percentage of the max resource value to the current value of the resource.

getPersistentEffects.description: Returns a list of the currently active persistent effects in the specified effect category.

addPersistentEffect.description: Adds a status effect to the specified effect category.

addPersistentEffects.description: Adds a list of effects to the specified effect category.

setPersistentEffects.description: Sets the list of effects of the specified effect category. Replaces the current list active effects.

clearPersistentEffects.description: Clears any status effects from the specified effect category.

clearAllPersistentEffects.description: Clears all persistent status effects from all effect categories.

addEphemeralEffect.description: Adds the specified unique status effect. Optionally with a custom duration, and optionally with a source entity id accessible in the status effect.

addEphemeralEffects.description:
Adds a list of unique status effects. Optionally with a source entity id.

Unique status effects can be specified either as a string, "myuniqueeffect", or as a table, {effect = "myuniqueeffect", duration = 5}. Remember that this function takes a `list` of these effect descriptors. This is a valid list of effects: { "myuniqueeffect", {effect = "myothereffect", duration = 5} }

removeEphemeralEffect.description: Removes the specified unique status effect.

damageTakenSince.description:
Returns two values:

* A list of damage notifications for the entity's damage taken since the specified heartbeat.
* The most recent heartbeat to be passed into the function again to get the damage notifications taken since this function call.

Example:  
```lua
_,lastStep = status.damageTakenSince() -- Returns the full buffer of damage notifications, throw this away, we only want the current step

-- stuff

notifications,lastStep = status.damageTakenSince(lastStep) -- Get the damage notifications since the last call, and update the heartbeat
```

inflictedHitsSince.description:
Returns two values:

* A list {{entityId, damageRequest}} for the entity's inflicted hits since the specified heartbeat.
* The most recent heartbeat to be passed into the function again to get the inflicted hits since this function call.

Example:  
```lua
_,lastStep = status.inflictedHitsSince() -- Returns the full buffer of damage notifications, throw this away, we only want the current step

-- stuff

notifications,lastStep = status.inflictedHitsSince(lastStep) -- Get the damage notifications since the last call, and update the heartbeat
```

inflictedDamageSince.description:
Returns two values:

* A list of damage notifications for damage inflicted by the entity.
* The most recent heartbeat to be passed into the function again to get the list of damage notifications since the last call.

Example:  
```lua
_,lastStep = status.inflictedDamageSince() -- Returns the full buffer of damage notifications, throw this away, we only want the current step

-- stuff

notifications,lastStep = status.inflictedDamageSince(lastStep) -- Get the damage notifications since the last call, and update the heartbeat
```

activeUniqueStatusEffectSummary.description: Returns a list of two element tables describing all unique status effects currently active on the status controller. Each entry consists of the `string` name of the effect and a `float` between 0 and 1 indicating the remaining portion of that effect's duration.

primaryDirectives.description: Returns the primary set of image processing directives applied to the animation of the entity using this status controller.

setPrimaryDirectives.description: Sets the primary set of image processing directives that should be applied to the animation of the entity using this status controller.

applySelfDamageRequest.description: Directly applies the specified damage request to the entity using this status controller.

uniqueStatusEffectActive.description: Returns `true` if the specified unique status effect is currently active and false otherwise.

sb.description: The sb table contains miscellaneous utility functions that don't directly relate to any assets or content of the game.

makeUuid.description: Returns a `string` representation of a new, randomly-created `Uuid`.

logInfo.description: Logs the specified formatted string, optionally using the formatted replacement values, to the log file and console with the Info log level.

logWarn.description: Logs the specified formatted string, optionally using the formatted replacement values, to the log file and console with the Warn log level.

logError.description: Logs the specified formatted string, optionally using the formatted replacement values, to the log file and console with the Error log level.

setLogMap.description: Sets an entry in the debug log map (visible while in debug mode) using the specified format string and optional formatted replacement values.

print.description: Returns a human-readable string representation of the specified `LuaValue`.

interpolateSinEase.description: Returns an interpolated `Vec2F` or `double` between the two specified values using a sin ease function.

replaceTags.description: Replaces all tags in the specified string with the specified tag replacement values.

jsonMerge.description: Returns the result of merging the contents of b on top of a.

jsonQuery.description: Attempts to extract the value in the specified content at the specified path, and returns the found value or the specified default if no such value exists.

staticRandomI32.description: Returns a statically randomized 32-bit signed integer based on the given list of seed values.

staticRandomI32Range.description: Returns a statically randomized 32-bit signed integer within the specified range based on the given list of seed values.

staticRandomDouble.description: Returns a statically randomized `double` based on the given list of seed values.

staticRandomDoubleRange.description: Returns a statically randomized `double` within the specified range based on the given list of seed values.

makeRandomSource.description: Creates and returns a Lua UserData value which can be used as a random source, initialized with the specified seed. The `RandomSource` has the following methods:

makePerlinSource.description:
Creates and returns a Lua UserData value which can be used as a Perlin noise source. The configuration for the `PerlinSource` should be a JSON object and can include the following keys:

* `unsigned` __seed__ - Seed value used to initialize the source.
* `string` __type__ - Type of noise to use. Valid types are `perlin`, `billow` or `ridgedMulti`.
* `int` __octaves__ - Number of octaves of noise to use. Defaults to 1.
* `double` __frequency__ - Defaults to 1.0.
* `double` __amplitude__ - Defaults to 1.0.
* `double` __bias__ - Defaults to 0.0.
* `double` __alpha__ - Defaults to 2.0.
* `double` __beta__ - Defaults to 2.0.
* `double` __offset__ - Defaults to 1.0.
* `double` __gain__ - Defaults to 2.0.

object.description: The object table contains bindings specific to objects which are available in addition to their common tables.

direction.description: Returns the object's facing direction. This will be 1 for right or -1 for left.

position.description: Returns the object's tile position. This is identical to entity.position(), so use that instead.

setInteractive.description: Sets whether the object is currently interactive.

uniqueId.description: Returns the object's unique entity id, or `nil` if no unique id is set. This should be identical to entity.uniqueId(), so use that instead.

setUniqueId.description: Sets the objects unique entity id, or clears it if unspecified.

boundBox.description: Returns the object's metaBoundBox in world space.

spaces.description: Returns a list of the tile spaces that the object occupies.

setProcessingDirectives.description: Sets the image processing directives that should be applied to the object's animation.

setSoundEffectEnabled.description: Enables or disables the object's persistent sound effect, if one is configured.

smash.description: Breaks the object. If smash is `true` then it will be smashed, causing it to (by default) drop no items.

level.description: Returns the "level" parameter if set, otherwise returns the current world's threat level.

toAbsolutePosition.description: Returns an absolute world position calculated from the given relative position.

say.description: Causes the object to say the line, optionally replacing any specified tags in the text, and using the provided additional chat configuration. Returns `true` if anything is said (i.e. the line is not empty) and `false` otherwise.

sayPortrait.description: Similar to object.say, but uses a portrait chat bubble with the specified portrait image.

isTouching.description: Returns `true` if the specified entity's collision area overlaps the object's bound box and `false` otherwise.

setLightColor.description: Sets the color of light for the object to emit. This is not the same as animator.setLightColor and the animator light configuration should be used for more featureful light sources.

getLightColor.description: Returns the object's currently configured light color.

inputNodeCount.description: Returns the number of wire input nodes the object has.

outputNodeCount.description: Returns the number of wire output nodes the object has

getInputNodePosition.description: Returns the relative position of the specified wire input node.

getOutputNodePosition.description: Returns the relative position of the specified wire output node.

getInputNodeLevel.description: Returns the current level of the specified wire input node.

getOutputNodeLevel.description: Returns the current level of the specified wire output node.

isInputNodeConnected.description: Returns `true` if any wires are currently connected to the specified wire input node and `false` otherwise.

isOutputNodeConnected.description: Returns `true` if any wires are currently connected to the specified wire output node and `false` otherwise.

getInputNodeIds.description: Returns a map of the entity id of each wire entity connected to the given wire input node and the index of that entity's output node to which the input node is connected.

getOutputNodeIds.description: Returns a map of the entity id of each wire entity connected to the given wire output node and the index of that entity's input node to which the output node is connected.

setOutputNodeLevel.description: Sets the level of the specified wire output node.

setAllOutputNodes.description: Sets the level of all wire output nodes.

setOfferedQuests.description: Sets the list of quests that the object will offer to start, or clears them if unspecified.

setTurnInQuests.description: Sets the list of quests that the object will accept turn-in for, or clears them if unspecified.

setConfigParameter.description: Sets the specified override configuration parameter for the object.

setAnimationParameter.description: Sets the specified animation parameter for the object's scripted animator.

setMaterialSpaces.description: Sets the object's material spaces to the specified list, or clears them if unspecified. List entries should be in the form of `pair<Vec2I, String>` specifying the relative position and material name of materials to be set. __Objects should only set material spaces within their occupied tile spaces to prevent Bad Things TM from happening.__

setDamageSources.description: Sets the object's active damage sources (or clears them if unspecified).

world.description: The `world` table contains functions that perform actions within a specified such as querying or modifying entities, tiles, etc. in that world.

type.description: Returns a string describing the world's type. For terrestrial worlds this will be the primary biome, for instance worlds this will be the instance name, and for ship or generic worlds this will be 'unknown'.

terrestrial.description: Returns a `true` if the current world is a terrestrial world, i.e. a planet, and `false` otherwise.

size.description: Returns a vector describing the size of the current world.

magnitude.description: Returns the magnitude of the distance between the specified world positions. Use this rather than simple vector subtraction to handle world wrapping.

distance.description: Returns the vector difference between the specified world positions. Use this rather than simple vector subtraction to handle world wrapping.

polyContains.description: Returns `true` if the specified poly contains the specified position in world space and `false` otherwise.

variants.description: Returns the specified position with its X coordinate wrapped around the world width.
Returns the specified X position wrapped around the world width.

Returns the point nearest to (i.e. on the same side of the world as) the source point. Either argument can be specified as a `Vec2F` point or as a `float` X position. The type of the targetPosition determines the return type.

Returns the point nearest to (i.e. on the same side of the world as) the source point. Either argument can be specified as a `Vec2F` point or as a `float` X position. The type of the targetPosition determines the return type.

Returns the point nearest to (i.e. on the same side of the world as) the source point. Either argument can be specified as a `Vec2F` point or as a `float` X position. The type of the targetPosition determines the return type.

Returns the point nearest to (i.e. on the same side of the world as) the source point. Either argument can be specified as a `Vec2F` point or as a `float` X position. The type of the targetPosition determines the return type.

pointCollision.description: Returns `true` if the generated collision geometry at the specified point matches any of the specified collision kinds and `false` otherwise.

pointTileCollision.description: Returns `true` if the tile at the specified point matches any of the specified collision kinds and `false` otherwise.

lineCollision.description: If the line between the specified points overlaps any generated collision geometry of the specified collision kinds, returns the point at which the line collides, or nil if the line does not collide. If intersecting a side of the poly, also returns the normal of the intersected side as a second return.

surfaceLevel.description: Returns the surface layer base height.

lineTileCollision.description: Returns `true` if the line between the specified points overlaps any tiles of the specified collision kinds and `false` otherwise.

lineTileCollisionPoint.description: Returns a table of {`position`, `normal`} where `position` is the position that the line intersects the first collidable tile, and `normal` is the collision normal. Returns `nil` if no tile is intersected.

rectCollision.description: Returns `true` if the specified rectangle overlaps any generated collision geometry of the specified collision kinds and `false` otherwise.

rectTileCollision.description: Returns `true` if the specified rectangle overlaps any tiles of the specified collision kinds and `false` otherwise.

polyCollision.description: Returns `true` if the specified polygon overlaps any generated collision geometry of the specified collision kinds and `false` otherwise. If a position is specified, the polygon coordinates will be treated as relative to that world position.
