collisionBlocksAlongLine.description: Returns an ordered list of tile positions along the line between the specified points that match any of the specified collision kinds. If maxReturnCount is specified, the function will only return up to that number of points.

liquidAlongLine.description: Returns a list of pairs containing a position and a `LiquidLevel` for all tiles along the line between the specified points that contain any liquid.

resolvePolyCollision.description: Attempts to move the specified poly (relative to the specified position) such that it does not collide with any of the specified collision kinds. Will only move the poly up to the distance specified by maximumCorrection. Returns `nil` if the collision resolution fails.

tileIsOccupied.description: Returns `true` if the specified tile position is occupied by a material or tile entity and `false` if it is empty. The check will be performed on the foreground tile layer if foregroundLayer is `true` (or unspecified) and the background tile layer if it is `false`. The check will include ephemeral tile entities such as preview objects if includeEphemeral is `true`, and will not include these entities if it is `false` (or unspecified).

placeObject.description: Attempts to place the specified object into the world at the specified position, preferring it to be right-facing if direction is positive (or unspecified) and left-facing if it is negative. If parameters are specified they will be applied to the object. Returns `true` if the object is placed successfully and `false` otherwise.

spawnItem.description: Attempts to spawn the specified item into the world as the specified position. If item is specified as a name, it will optionally apply the specified count and parameters. The item drop entity can also be spawned with an initial velocity and intangible time (delay before it can be picked up) if specified. Returns an `EntityId` of the item drop if successful and `nil` otherwise.

spawnTreasure.description: Attempts to spawn all items in an instance of the specified treasure pool with the specified level and seed at the specified world position. Returns a list of `EntityId`s of the item drops created if successful and `nil` otherwise.

spawnMonster.description: Attempts to spawn a monster of the specified type at the specified position. If parameters are specified they will be applied to the spawned monster. If they are unspecified, they default to an object setting aggressive to be randomly `true` or `false`. Level for the monster may be specified in parameters. Returns the `EntityId` of the spawned monster if successful and `nil` otherwise.

spawnNpc.description: Attempts to spawn an NPC of the specified type, species, level with the specified seed and parameters at the specified position. Returns `EntityId` of the spawned NPC if successful and `nil` otherwise.

spawnStagehand.description: Attempts to spawn a stagehand of the specified type at the specified position with the specified override parameters. Returns `EntityId` of the spawned stagehand if successful and `nil` otherwise.

spawnProjectile.description: Attempts to spawn a projectile of the specified type at the specified position with the specified source entity id, direction, and parameters. If trackSourceEntity is `true` then the projectile's position will be locked relative to its source entity's position. Returns the `EntityId` of the spawned projectile if successful and `nil` otherwise.

spawnVehicle.description: Attempts to spawn a vehicle of the specified type at the specified position with the specified override parameters. Returns the `EntityId` of the spawned vehicle if successful and `nil` otherwise.

threatLevel.description: Returns the threat level of the current world.

time.description: Returns the absolute time of the current world.

day.description: Returns the absolute numerical day of the current world.

timeOfDay.description: Returns a value between 0 and 1 indicating the time within the day of the current world.

dayLength.description: Returns the duration of a day on the current world.

getProperty.description: Returns the JSON value of the specified world property, or defaultValue or `nil` if it is not set.

setProperty.description: Sets the specified world property to the specified value.

variants.description: Returns the `LiquidLevel` at the specified tile position, or `nil` if there is no liquid.
Returns the average `LiquidLevel` of the most plentiful liquid within the specified region, or `nil` if there is no liquid.

gravity.description: Returns the gravity at the specified position. This should be consistent for all non-dungeon tiles in a world but can be altered by dungeons.

spawnLiquid.description: Attempts to place the specified quantity of the specified liquid at the specified position. Returns `true` if successful and `false` otherwise.

destroyLiquid.description: Removes any liquid at the specified position and returns the LiquidLevel containing the type and quantity of liquid removed, or `nil` if no liquid is removed.

isTileProtected.description: Returns `true` if the tile at the specified position is protected and `false` otherwise.

findPlatformerPath.description: Attempts to synchronously pathfind between the specified positions using the specified movement and pathfinding parameters. Returns the path as a list of nodes as successful, or `nil` if no path is found.

platformerPathStart.description:
Creates and returns a Lua UserData value which can be used for pathfinding over multiple frames. The `PathFinder` returned has the following two methods:

##### `bool` explore([`int` nodeLimit])

Explores the path up to the specified node count limit. Returns `true` if the pathfinding is complete and `false` if it is still incomplete. If nodeLimit is unspecified, this will search up to the configured maximum number of nodes, making it equivalent to world.platformerPathStart.

##### `PlatformerAStar::Path` result()

Returns the completed path.

lightLevel.description: Returns the current logical light level at the specified position. Requires recalculation of lighting, so this should be used sparingly.

windLevel.description: Returns the current wind level at the specified position.

breathable.description: Returns `true` if the world is breathable at the specified position and `false` otherwise.

environmentStatusEffects.description: Returns a list of the environmental status effects at the specified position.

underground.description: Returns `true` if the specified position is below the world's surface level and `false` otherwise.

inSurfaceLayer.description: Returns `true` if the world is terrestrial and the specified position is within its surface layer, and `false` otherwise.

oceanLevel.description: If the specified position is within a region that has ocean (endless) liquid, returns the world Y level of that ocean's surface, or 0 if there is no ocean in the specified region.

material.description: Returns the name of the material at the specified position and layer. Layer can be specified as 'foreground' or 'background'. Returns `false` if the space is empty in that layer. Returns `nil` if the material is NullMaterial (e.g. if the position is in an unloaded sector).

mod.description: Returns the name of the mod at the specified position and layer, or `nil` if there is no mod.

materialHueShift.description: Returns the hue shift of the material at the specified position and layer.

modHueShift.description: Returns the hue shift of the mod at the specified position and layer.

materialColor.description: Returns the color variant (painted color) of the material at the specified position and layer.

damageTiles.description: Damages all tiles in the specified layer and positions by the specified amount. The source position of the damage determines the initial direction of the damage particles. Damage types are: "plantish", "blockish", "beamish", "explosive", "fire", "tilling". Harvest level determines whether destroyed materials or mods will drop as items. Returns `true` if any damage was done and `false` otherwise.

damageTileArea.description: Identical to world.damageTiles but applies to tiles in a circular radius around the specified center point.

placeMaterial.description: Attempts to place the specified material in the specified position and layer. If allowOverlap is `true` the material can be placed in a space occupied by mobile entities, otherwise such placement attempts will fail. Returns `true` if the placement succeeds and `false` otherwise.

placeMod.description: Attempts to place the specified mod in the specified position and layer. If allowOverlap is `true` the mod can be placed in a space occupied by mobile entities, otherwise such placement attempts will fail. Returns `true` if the placement succeeds and `false` otherwise.

entityQuery.description:
Queries for entities in a specified area of the world and returns a list of their entity ids. Area can be specified either as the `Vec2F` lower left and upper right positions of a rectangle, or as the `Vec2F` center and `float` radius of a circular area.

The following additional parameters can be specified in options:

* __withoutEntityId__ - Specifies an `EntityId` that will be excluded from the returned results
* __includedTypes__ - Specifies a list of one or more `string` entity types that the query will return. In addition to standard entity type names, this list can include "mobile" for all mobile entity types or "creature" for players, monsters and NPCs.
* __boundMode__ - Specifies the bounding mode for determining whether entities fall within the query area. Valid options are "position", "collisionarea", "metaboundbox". Defaults to "collisionarea" if unspecified.
* __order__ - A `string` used to specify how the results will be ordered. If this is set to "nearest" the entities will be sorted by ascending distance from the first positional argument. If this is set to "random" the list of results will be shuffled.
* __callScript__ - Specifies a `string` name of a function that should be called in the script context of all scripted entities matching the query.
* __callScriptArgs__ - Specifies a list of arguments that will be passed to the function called by callScript.
* __callScriptResult__ - Specifies a `LuaValue` that the function called by callScript must return; entities whose script calls do not return this value will be excluded from the results. Defaults to `true`.

monsterQuery.description:
Identical to world.entityQuery but only considers monsters.

The following additional parameters can be specified in options:

* __withoutEntityId__ - Specifies an `EntityId` that will be excluded from the returned results
* __includedTypes__ - Specifies a list of one or more `string` entity types that the query will return. In addition to standard entity type names, this list can include "mobile" for all mobile entity types or "creature" for players, monsters and NPCs.

* __order__ - A `string` used to specify how the results will be ordered. If this is set to "nearest" the entities will be sorted by ascending distance from the first positional argument. If this is set to "random" the list of results will be shuffled.
* __callScript__ - Specifies a `string` name of a function that should be called in the script context of all scripted entities matching the query.
* __callScriptArgs__ - Specifies a list of arguments that will be passed to the function called by callScript.
* __callScriptResult__ - Specifies a `LuaValue` that the function called by callScript must return; entities whose script calls do not return this value will be excluded from the results. Defaults to `true`.

objectQuery.description:
Similar to world.entityQuery but only considers objects. Allows an additional option, __name__, which specifies a `string` object type name and will only return objects of that type.

The following additional parameters can be specified in options:

loungeableQuery.description:

entityLineQuery.description:

objectAt.description: Returns the entity id of any object occupying the specified tile position, or `nil` if the position is not occupied by an object.

entityDamageTeam.description: Returns the current damage team (team type and team number) of the specified entity, or `nil` if the entity doesn't exist.

entityCanDamage.description: Returns `true` if the specified source entity can damage the specified target entity using their current damage teams and `false` otherwise.

entityAggressive.description: Returns `true` if the specified entity is an aggressive monster or NPC and `false` otherwise.

entityType.description: Returns the entity type name of the specified entity, or `nil` if the entity doesn't exist.

entityPosition.description: Returns the current world position of the specified entity, or `nil` if the entity doesn't exist.

entityMouthPosition.description: Returns the current world mouth position of the specified player, monster, NPC or object, or `nil` if the entity doesn't exist or isn't a valid type.

entityVelocity.description: Returns the current velocity of the entity if it is a vehicle, monster, NPC or player and `nil` otherwise.

entityCurrency.description: Returns the specified player entity's stock of the specified currency type, or `nil` if the entity is not a player.

entityHasCountOfItem.description:
Returns the nubmer of the specified item that the specified player entity is currently carrying, or `nil` if the entity is not a player. If exactMatch is `true` then parameters as well as item name must match.

NOTE: This function currently does not work correctly over the network, making it inaccurate when not used from client side scripts such as status.

entityHealth.description: Returns a `Vec2F` containing the specified entity's current and maximum health if the entity is a player, monster or NPC and `nil` otherwise.

entitySpecies.description: Returns the name of the specified entity's species if it is a player or NPC and `nil` otherwise.

entityGender.description: Returns the name of the specified entity's gender if it is a player or NPC and `nil` otherwise.

entityName.description: Returns a `string` name of the specified entity which has different behavior for different entity types. For players, monsters and NPCs, this will be the configured name of the specific entity. For objects or vehicles, this will be the name of the object or vehicle type. For item drops, this will be the name of the contained item.

entityTypeName.description: Similar to world.entityName but returns the names of configured types for NPCs and monsters.

entityDescription.description: Returns the configured description for the specified inspectable entity (currently only objects and plants support this). Will return a species-specific description if species is specified and a generic description otherwise.

entityPortrait.description: Generates a portrait of the specified entity in the specified portrait mode and returns a list of drawables, or `nil` if the entity is not a portrait entity.

entityHandItem.description: Returns the name of the item held in the specified hand of the specified player or NPC, or `nil` if the entity is not holding an item or is not a player or NPC. Hand name should be specified as "primary" or "alt".

entityHandItemDescriptor.description: Returns the item descriptor of an item drop's contents.

itemDropItem.description: Returns the item descriptor of an item drop's contents.

entityUniqueId.description: Returns the unique id of the specified entity, or `nil` if the entity does not have a unique id.

getObjectParameter.description: Returns the value of the specified object's config parameter, or defaultValue or `nil` if the parameter is not set or the entity is not an object.

objectSpaces.description: Returns a list of tile positions that the specified object occupies, or `nil` if the entity is not an object.

farmableStage.description: Returns the current growth stage of the specified farmable object, or `nil` if the entity is not a farmable object.

containerSize.description: Returns the total capacity of the specified container, or `nil` if the entity is not a container.

containerClose.description: Visually closes the specified container. Returns `true` if the entity is a container and `false` otherwise.

containerOpen.description: Visually opens the specified container. Returns `true` if the entity is a container and `false` otherwise.

containerItems.description: Returns a list of pairs of item descriptors and container positions of all items in the specified container, or `nil` if the entity is not a container.

containerOpen.description: Returns an item descriptor of the item at the specified position in the specified container, or `nil` if the entity is not a container or the offset is out of range.

containerConsume.description: Attempts to consume items from the specified container that match the specified item descriptor and returns `true` if successful, `false` if unsuccessful, or `nil` if the entity is not a container. Only succeeds if the full count of the specified item can be consumed.

containerConsumeAt.description: Similar to world.containerConsume but only considers the specified slot within the container.

containerAvailable.description: Returns the number of the specified item that are currently available to consume in the specified container, or `nil` if the entity is not a container.

containerTakeAll.description: Similar to world.containerItems but consumes all items in the container.

containerTakeAt.description: Similar to world.containerItemAt, but consumes all items in the specified slot of the container.

containerTakeNumItemsAt.description: Similar to world.containerTakeAt, but consumes up to (but not necessarily equal to) the specified count of items from the specified slot of the container and returns only the items consumed.

containerItemsCanFit.description: Returns the number of times the specified item can fit in the specified container, or `nil` if the entity is not a container.

containerItemsFitWhere.description: Returns a JsonObject containing a list of "slots" the specified item would fit and the count of "leftover" items that would remain after attempting to add the items. Returns `nil` if the entity is not a container.

containerAddItems.description: Adds the specified items to the specified container. Returns the leftover items after filling the container, or all items if the entity is not a container.

containerStackItems.description: Similar to world.containerAddItems but will only combine items with existing stacks and will not fill empty slots.

containerPutItemsAt.description: Similar to world.containerAddItems but only considers the specified slot in the container.

containerItemApply.description: Attempts to combine the specified items with the current contents (if any) of the specified container slot and returns any items unable to be placed into the slot.

containerSwapItemsNoCombine.description: Places the specified items into the specified container slot and returns the previous contents of the slot if successful, or the original items if unsuccessful.

containerSwapItems.description: A combination of world.containerItemApply and world.containerSwapItemsNoCombine that attempts to combine items before swapping and returns the leftovers if stacking was successful or the previous contents of the container slot if the items did not stack.

callScriptedEntity.description: Attempts to call the specified function name in the context of the specified scripted entity with the specified arguments and returns the result. This method is synchronous and thus can only be used on local master entities, i.e. scripts run on the server may only call scripted entities that are also server-side master and scripts run on the client may only call scripted entities that are client-side master on that client. For more featureful entity messaging, use world.sendEntityMessage.

sendEntityMessage.description: Sends an asynchronous message to an entity with the specified entity id or unique id with the specified message type and arguments and returns an `RpcPromise` which can be used to receive the result of the message when available. See the message table for information on entity message handling. This function __should not be called in any entity's init function__ as the sending entity will not have been fully loaded. messaging, use world.sendEntityMessage.

findUniqueEntity.description: Attempts to find an entity on the server by unique id and returns an `RpcPromise` that can be used to get the position of that entity if successful.

loungeableOccupied.description: Checks whether the specified loungeable entity is currently occupied and returns `true` if it is occupied, `false` if it is unoccupied, or `nil` if it is not a loungeable entity.

isMonster.description: Returns `true` if the specified entity exists and is a monster and `false` otherwise. If aggressive is specified, will return `false` unless the monster's aggressive state matches the specified value.

monsterType.description: Returns the monster type of the specified monster, or `nil` if the entity is not a monster.

isNpc.description: Returns `true` if the specified entity exists and is an NPC and `false` otherwise. If damageTeam is specified, will return `false` unless the NPC's damage team number matches the specified value.

npcType.description: Returns the NPC type of the specified NPC, or `nil` if the entity is not an NPC.

stagehandType.description: Returns the stagehand type of the specified stagehand, or `nil` if the entity is not a stagehand.

debugPoint.description: Displays a point visible in debug mode at the specified world position.

debugLine.description: Displayes a line visible in debug mode between the specified world positions.

debugPoly.description: Displays a polygon consisting of the specified points that is visible in debug mode.

debugText.description: Displays text visible in debug mode at the specified position using the specified format string and optional formatted values.

breakObject.description:
###only works in server side scripts

Breaks the specified object and returns `true` if successful and `false` otherwise. If smash is `true` the object will not (by default) drop any items.

isVisibleToPlayer.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Returns `true` if any part of the specified region overlaps any player's screen area and `false` otherwise.

loadRegion.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Attempts to load all sectors overlapping the specified region and returns `true` if all sectors are fully loaded and `false` otherwise.

regionActive.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Returns `true` if all sectors overlapping the specified region are fully loaded and `false` otherwise.

setTileProtection.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Enables or disables tile protection for the specified dungeon id.

dungeonId.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Returns the dungeon id at the specified world position.

setDungeonId.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Sets the dungeonId of all tiles within the specified area.

isPlayerModified.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Returns `true` if any tile within the specified region has been modified (placed or broken) by a player and `false` otherwise.

forceDestroyLiquid.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Identical to world.destroyLiquid but ignores tile protection.

loadUniqueEntity.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Forces (synchronous) loading of the specified unique entity and returns its non-unique entity id or 0 if no such unique entity exists.

setUniqueId.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Sets the unique id of the specified entity to the specified unique id or clears it if no unique id is specified.

takeItemDrop.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Takes the specified item drop and returns an `ItemDescriptor` of its contents or `nil` if the operation fails. If a source entity id is specified, the item drop will briefly animate toward that entity.

setPlayerStart.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Sets the world's default beam-down point to the specified position. If respawnInWorld is set to `true` then players who die in that world will respawn at the specified start position rather than being returned to their ships.

players.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Returns a list of the entity ids of all players currently in the world.

fidelity.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Returns the name of the fidelity level at which the world is currently running. See worldserver.config for fidelity configuration.

flyingType.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Returns the current flight status of a ship world.

warpPhase.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Returns the current warp phase of a ship world.

setUniverseFlag.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Sets the specified universe flag on the current universe.

universeFlags.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Returns a list of all universe flags set on the current universe.

universeFlagSet.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Returns `true` if the specified universe flag is set and `false` otherwise.

skyTime.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Returns the current time for the world's sky.

setSkyTime.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Sets the current time for the world's sky to the specified value.

placeDungeon.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Generates the specified dungeon in the world at the specified position, ignoring normal dungeon anchoring rules. If a dungeon id is specified, it will be assigned to the dungeon.

addBiomeRegion.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Adds a biome region to the world, centered on `position`, `width` blocks wide.

expandBiomeRegion.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Expands the biome region currently at `position` by `width` blocks.

pregenerateAddBiome.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Signals a region for asynchronous generation. The region signaled is the region that needs to be generated to add a biome region of `width` tiles to `position`.

pregenerateExpandBiome.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Signals a region for asynchronous generation. The region signaled is the region that needs to be generated to expand the biome at `position` by `width` blocks.

setLayerEnvironmentBiome.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Sets the environment biome for a layer to the biome at `position`.

setPlanetType.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Sets the planet type of the current world to `planetType` with primary biome `primaryBiomeName`.

setDungeonGravity.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Sets the overriding gravity for the specified dungeon id, or returns it to the world default if unspecified.

setDungeonBreathable.description:
### only works in server side scripts

Sets the overriding breathability for the specified dungeon id, or returns it to the world default if unspecified.

radialTileQuery.description: Returns a list of existing tiles within `radius` of the given position, on the specified tile layer.

entityMetaBoundBOx.description: Returns the meta bound box of the entity, if any.
Returns the list of biome specific blocks that can place in the biome at the specified position.

getNpcScriptParameter.description: Returns the value of the specified NPC's variant script config parameter, or defaultValue or nil if the parameter is not set or the entity is not an NPC.

enqueuePlacement.description: Enqueues a biome distribution config for placement through world generation. The returned promise is fulfilled with the position of the placement, once it has been placed.

placeDungeon.description: Generates the specified dungeon in the world at the specified position. Does not ignore anchoring rules, will fail if the dungeon can't be placed. If a dungeon id is specified, it will be assigned to the dungeon.

player.description: The player table contains functions with privileged access to the player which run in a few contexts on the client such as scripted interface panes, quests, player companions, techs and active items.

isAdmin.description: Returns whether the player is admin.

getProperty.description: Returns the value assigned to the specified generic player property. If there is no value set, returns default.

setProperty.description: Sets a generic player property to the specified value.

addScannedObject.description: Adds the specified object to the player's scanned objects.

removeScannedObject.description: Removes the specified object from the player's scanned objects.

interact.description: Triggers an interact action on the player as if they had initiated an interaction and the result had returned the specified interaction type and configuration. Can be used to e.g. open GUI windows normally triggered by player interaction with entities.

shipUpgrades.description: Returns a JSON object containing information about the player's current ship upgrades including "shipLevel", "maxFuel", "crewSize" and a list of "capabilities".

upgradeShip.description: Applies the specified ship upgrades to the player's ship.

setUniverseFlag.description: Sets the specified universe flag on the player's current universe.

giveBlueprint.description: Teaches the player any recipes which can be used to craft the specified item.

blueprintKnown.description: Returns `true` if the player knows one or more recipes to create the specified item and `false` otherwise.

makeTechAvailable.description: Adds the specified tech to the player's list of available (unlockable) techs.

makeTechUnavailable.description: Removes the specified tech from player's list of available (unlockable) techs.

enableTech.description: Unlocks the specified tech, allowing it to be equipped through the tech GUI.

availableTechs.description: Returns a list of the techs currently available to the player.

enabledTechs.description: Returns a list of the techs currently unlocked by the player.

equippedTech.description: Returns the name of the tech the player has currently equipped in the specified slot, or `nil` if no tech is equipped in that slot.

currency.description: Returns the player's current total reserves of the specified currency.

addCurrency.description: Increases the player's reserve of the specified currency by the specified amount.

consumeCurrency.description: Attempts to consume the specified amount of the specified currency and returns `true` if successful and `false` otherwise.

cleanupItems.description: Triggers an immediate cleanup of the player's inventory, removing item stacks with 0 quantity. May rarely be required in special cases of making several sequential modifications to the player's inventory within a single tick.

giveItem.description: Adds the specified item to the player's inventory.

hasItem.description: Returns `true` if the player's inventory contains an item matching the specified descriptor and `false` otherwise. If exactMatch is `true` then parameters as well as item name must match.

hasCountOfItem.description: Returns the total number of items in the player's inventory matching the specified descriptor. If exactMatch is `true` then parameters as well as item name must match.

consumeItem.description: Attempts to consume the specified item from the player's inventory and returns the item consumed if successful. If consumePartial is `true`, matching stacks totalling fewer items than the requested count may be consumed, otherwise the operation will only be performed if the full count can be consumed. If exactMatch is `true` then parameters as well as item name must match.

inventoryTags.description: Returns a summary of all tags of all items in the player's inventory. Keys in the returned map are tag names and their corresponding values are the total count of items including that tag.

itemsWithTag.description: Returns a list of `ItemDescriptor`s for all items in the player's inventory that include the specified tag.

consumeTaggedItem.description: Consumes items from the player's inventory that include the matching tag, up to the specified count of items.

hasItemWithParameter.description: Returns `true` if the player's inventory contains at least one item which has the specified parameter set to the specified value.

consumeItemWithParameter.description: Consumes items from the player's inventory that have the specified parameter set to the specified value, upt to the specified count of items.

getItemWithParameter.description: Returns the first item in the player's inventory that has the specified parameter set to the specified value, or `nil` if no such item is found.

primaryHandItem.description: Returns the player's currently equipped primary hand item, or `nil` if no item is equipped.

altHandItem.description: Returns the player's currently equipped alt hand item, or `nil` if no item is equipped.

primaryHandItemTags.description: Returns a list of the tags on the currently equipped primary hand item, or `nil` if no item is equipped.

altHandItemTags.description: Returns a list of the tags on the currently equipped alt hand item, or `nil` if no item is equipped.

essentialItem.description: Returns the contents of the specified essential slot, or `nil` if the slot is empty. Essential slot names are "beamaxe", "wiretool", "painttool" and "inspectiontool".

giveEssentialItem.description: Sets the contents of the specified essential slot to the specified item.

removeEssentialItem.description: Removes the essential item in the specified slot.

equippedItem.description: Returns the contents of the specified equipment slot, or `nil` if the slot is empty. Equipment slot names are "head", "chest", "legs", "back", "headCosmetic", "chestCosmetic", "legsCosmetic" and "backCosmetic".

setEquippedItem.description: Sets the item in the specified equipment slot to the specified item.

swapSlotItem.description: Returns the contents of the player's swap (cursor) slot, or `nil` if the slot is empty.

setSwapSlotItem.description: Sets the item in the player's swap (cursor) slot to the specified item.

canStartQuest.description: Returns `true` if the player meets all of the prerequisites to start the specified quest and `false` otherwise.

startQuest.description: Starts the specified quest, optionally using the specified server Uuid and world id, and returns the quest id of the started quest.

hasQuest.description: Returns `true` if the player has a quest, in any state, with the specified quest id and `false` otherwise.

hasCompletedQuest.description: Returns `true` if the player has a completed quest with the specified quest id and `false` otherwise.

enableMission.description: Adds the specified mission to the player's list of available missions.

completeMission.description: Adds the specified mission to the player's list of completed missions.

radioMessage.description: Triggers the specified radio message for the player, either immediately or with the specified delay.

worldId.description: Returns a `string` representation of the world id of the player's current world.

serverUuid.description: Returns a `string` representation of the player's Uuid on the server.

ownShipWorldId.description: Returns a `string` representation of the world id of the player's ship world.

lounge.description: Triggers the player to lounge in the specified loungeable entity at the specified lounge anchor index (default is 0).

isLounging.description: Returns `true` if the player is currently occupying a loungeable entity and `false` otherwise.

loungingIn.description: If the player is currently lounging, returns the entity id of what they are lounging in.

playTime.description: Returns the total played time for the player.

introComplete.description: Returns `true` if the player is marked as having completed the intro instance and `false` otherwise.

setIntroComplete.description: Sets whether the player is marked as having completed the intro instance.

canDeploy.description: Returns whether the player has a deployable mech.

isDeployed.description: Returns whether the player is currently deployed in a mech.

confirm.description: Displays a confirmation dialog to the player with the specified dialog configuration and returns an `RpcPromise` which can be used to retrieve the player's response to that dialog.

playCinematic.description: Triggers the specified cinematic to be displayed for the player. If unique is `true` the cinematic will only be shown to that player once.

recordEvent.description: Triggers the specified event on the player with the specified fields. Used to record data e.g. for achievements.

worldHasOrbitBookmark.description: Returns whether the player has a bookmark for the specified celestial coordinate.

orbitBookmarks.description: Returns a list of orbit bookmarks with their system coordinates.

systemBookmarks.description: Returns a list of orbit bookmarks in the specified system.

addOrbitBookmark.description: Adds the specified bookmark to the player's bookmark list and returns `true` if the bookmark was successfully added (and was not already known) and `false` otherwise.

removeOrbitBookmark.description: Removes the specified bookmark from the player's bookmark list and returns `true` if the bookmark was successfully removed and `false` otherwise.

addTeleportBookmark.description: Adds the specified bookmark to the player's bookmark list and returns `true` if the bookmark was successfully added (and was not already known) and `false` otherwise.

isMapped.description: Returns whether the player has previously visited the specified coordinate.

mappedObjects.description: Returns uuid, type, and orbits for all system objects in the specified system.

collectables.description: Returns a list of names of the collectables the player has unlocked in the specified collection.

hasAcceptedQuest.description: Returns `true` if the player has accepted a quest (which may be active, completed, or failed) with the specified quest id and `false` otherwise.

hasActiveQuest.description: Returns `true` if the player has a currently active quest with the specified quest id and `false` otherwise.

currentQuestWorld.description: If the player's currently tracked quest has an associated world, returns the id of that world.

questWorlds.description: Returns a list of world ids for worlds relevant to the player's current quests, along with a boolean indicating whether that quest is tracked.

currentQuestLocation.description: If the player's currently tracked quest has an associated location (CelestialCoordinate, system orbit, UUID, or system position) returns that location.

questLocations.description: If the player's currently tracked quest has an associated location (CelestialCoordinate, system orbit, UUID, or system position) returns that location.

hasCompletedMission.description: Returns whether the player has completed the specified mission.

teleportBookmarks.description: Lists all of the player's teleport bookmarks.

widget.description:
The `widget` table contains functions to manipulate and get data about widgets in a scriptpane.

The widgetName passed into most of these functions can contain period separators for getting children.

Example:
```
widget.getPosition("itemScrollArea.itemList.1.name")
```

getPosition.description: Returns the position of a widget.

setPosition.description: Sets the position of a widget.

getSize.description: Returns the size of a widget.

setSize.description: Sets the size of a widget.

setVisible.description: Sets the visibility of a widget.

active.description: Returns whether the widget is visible.

focus.description: Sets focus on the specified widget.

hasFocus.description: Returns whether the specified widget is currently focused.

blur.description: Unsets focus on the specified focused widget.

getData.description: Returns the arbitrary data value set for the widget.

setData.description: Sets arbitrary data for the widget.

getChildAt.description: Returns the full name for any widget at screenPosition.

inMember.description: Returns whether the widget contains the specified screenPosition.

getText.description: Returns the text set in a TextBoxWidget.

setText.description: Sets the text of: LabelWidget, ButtonWidget, TextBoxWidget

setFontColor.description: Sets the font color of: LabelWidget, ButtonWidget, TextBoxWidget

setImage.description: Sets the font color of: LabelWidget, ButtonWidget, TextBoxWidget

setImageScale.description: Sets the scale of an ImageWidget.

setImageRotation.description: Sets the rotation of an ImageWidget.

setButtonEnabled.description: Sets whether the ButtonWidget should be enabled.

setButtonImage.description: Sets whether the ButtonWidget should be enabled.

setButtonImages.description:
Sets the full image set of a ButtonWidget.

```
{
    base = "image.png",
    hover = "image.png",
    pressed = "image.png",
    disabled = "image.png",
}
```

setButtonCheckedImages.description: Similar to widget.setButtonImages, but sets the images used for the checked state of a checkable ButtonWidget.

setButtonOverlayImage.description: Sets the overlay image of a ButtonWidget.

getChecked.description: Returns whether the ButtonWidget is checked.

setChecked.description: Sets whether a ButtonWidget is checked.

getSelectedOption.description: Returns the index of the selected option in a ButtonGroupWidget.

getSelectedData.description: Returns the data of the selected option in a ButtonGroupWidget. Nil if no option is selected.

setSelectedOption.description: Sets the selected option index of a ButtonGroupWidget.

setOptionEnabled.description: Sets whether a ButtonGroupWidget option should be enabled.

setOptionVisible.description: Sets whether a ButtonGroupWidget option should be visible.

setProgress.description: Sets the progress of a ProgressWidget. Value should be between 0.0 and 1.0.

setSliderEnabled.description: Sets whether the SliderBarWidget should be enabled.

getSliderValue.description: Gets the current value of a SliderBarWidget.

setSliderValue.description: Sets the current value of a SliderBarWidget.

getSliderRange.description: Sets the minimum, maximum and (optionally) delta values of a SliderBarWidget.

clearListItems.description: Clears all items in a ListWidget.

addListItem.description: Adds a list item to a ListWidget using the configured template, and returns the name of the added list item.

removeListItem.description: Removes a list item from a ListWidget at a specific index.

getListSelected.description: Returns the name of the currently selected widget in a ListWidget.

setListSelected.description: Sets the selected widget of a ListWidget.

registerMemberCallback.description: Registers a member callback for a ListWidget's list items to use.

itemGridItems.description: Returns the full item bag contents of an ItemGridWidget.

itemSlotItem.description: Returns the descriptor of the item in the specified item slot widget.

setItemSlotItem.description: Sets the item in the specified item slot widget.

setItemSlotProgress.description: Sets the progress overlay on the item slot to the specified value (between 0 and 1).

bindCanvas.description: Binds the canvas widget with the specified name as userdata for easy access.

addChild.description: Creates a new child widget with the specified config and adds it to the specified widget, optionally with the specified name.

removeAllChildren.description: Removes all child widgets of the specified widget.

removeChild.description: Removes the specified child widget from the specified widget.

root.description: The `root` table contains functions that reference the game's currently loaded assets and don't relate to any more specific context such as a particular world or universe.

assetJson.description: Returns the contents of the specified JSON asset file.

makeCurrentVersionedJson.description: Returns a versioned JSON representation of the given JSON content with the given identifier and the most recent version as specified in `versioning.config`.

loadVersionedJson.description: Returns the given JSON content and identifier after applying appropriate versioning scripts to bring it up to the most recent version as specified in `versioning.config`.

evalFunction.description: Returns the evaluation of the specified univariate function (as defined in a `.functions` file) for the given input value.

evalFunction2.description: Returns the evaluation of the specified bivariate function (as defined in a `.2functions` file) for the given input values.

imageSize.description: Returns the pixel dimensions of the specified image asset.

imageSpaces.description: Returns a list of the world tile spaces the image would occupy if placed at the given position using the specified spaceScan value (the portion of a space that must be non-transparent for that space to count as filled).

nonEmptyRegion.description: Returns the rectangle containing the portion of the specified asset image that is non-transparent.

npcConfig.description: Returns a representation of the generated JSON configuration for an NPC of the given type.

npcVariant.description: Generates an NPC with the specified species, type, level, seed and parameters, and returns its configuration.

projectileGravityMultiplier.description: Returns the gravity multiplier of the given projectile's movement controller configuration as configured in `physics.config`.

projectileConfig.description: Returns a representation of the JSON configuration for the given projectile.

recipesForItem.description: Returns a list of JSON configurations of all recipes which output the given item.

itemType.description: Returns the item type name for the specified item.

itemTags.description: Returns a list of the tags applied to the specified item.

itemHasTag.description: Returns true if the given item's tags include the specified tag and false otherwise.

itemConfig.description: Generates an item from the specified descriptor, level and seed and returns a JSON object containing the `directory`, `config` and `parameters` for that item.

createItem.description: Generates an item from the specified descriptor, level and seed and returns a new item descriptor for the resulting item.

tenantConfig.description: Returns the JSON configuration for the given tenant.

getMatchingTenants.description: Returns an array of JSON configurations of tenants matching the given map of colony tags and corresponding object counts.

liquidStatusEffects.description: Returns an array of status effects applied by the given liquid.

generateName.description: Returns a randomly generated name using the specified name gen config and seed.

questConfig.description: Returns the JSON configuration of the specified quest template.

npcPortrait.description: Generates an NPC with the specified type, level, seed and parameters and returns a portrait in the given portraitMode as a list of drawables.

monsterPortrait.description: Generates a monster of the given type with the given parameters and returns its portrait as a list of drawables.

isTreasurePool.description: Returns true if the given treasure pool exists and false otherwise. Can be used to guard against errors attempting to generate invalid treasure.

createTreasure.description: Generates an instance of the specified treasure pool, level and seed and returns the contents as a list of item descriptors.

materialMiningSound.description: Returns the path of the mining sound asset for the given material and mod combination, or `nil` if no mining sound is set.

materialFootstepSound.description: Returns the path of the footstep sound asset for the given material and mod combination, or `nil` if no footstep sound is set.

materialHealth.description: Returns the configured health value for the specified material.

materialConfig.description: Returns a JSON object containing the `path` and base `config` for the specified material if it is a real material, or `nil` if it is a metamaterial or invalid.

modConfig.description: Returns a JSON object containing the `path` and base `config` for the specified mod if it is a real mod, or `nil` if it is a metamod or invalid.

behavior.description:
Loads a behavior and returns the behavior state as userdata.

context is the current lua context called from, in almost all cases _ENV.

config can be either the `string` name of a behavior tree, or an entire behavior tree configuration to be built.

parameters is overrides for parameters for the behavior tree.

BehaviorState contains 3 methods:

behavior:init(_ENV) -- initializes the behavior, loads required scripts, and returns a new behavior state
behavior:run(state, dt) -- runs the behavior, takes a behavior state for the first argument
behavior:clear(state) -- resets the internal state of the behavior

Example:

```lua
function init()
    self.behavior = root.behavior("monster", {})
    self.behaviorState = self.behavior:init(_ENV)
end

function update(dt)
    self.behavior:run(self.behaviorState, dt)
end
```

setDamageParts.description:
Sets the monster's active damage parts. Damage parts must be defined in the monster's configuration parameters. A damage part specifies a damage source and an animation part to anchor the damage source to. The anchor part's transformation will be applied to the damage source's damage poly, and if a vector, the damage source's knockback.

```json"animationDamageParts" : {  "beam" : {
        "anchorPart" : "partName", // animation part to anchor the damage source to
        "checkLineCollision" : false, // optional, if the damage source is a line, check for collision along the line
        "bounces" : 0, // optional, if the damage source is a line and it checks for collision
        "damageSource" : {
            "line" : [ [0.0, 0.0], [5.0, 0.0] ],
            "damage" : 10,
            "damageSourceKind" : "default",
            "teamType" : "enemy",
            "teamNumber" : 2
        }
    }
}
```

```lua
monster.setDamageParts({"beam"}) -- sets the "beam" damage part active
```

If specified as a map, the pool should contain a "default" entry for unhandled damage types.

SystemLocation.description:
An array table containing data about a location withing a system  
It may contain a combination of 3 things:  

--- 

#### A celestial coordinate.
The first element is a string with the value of `"coordinate"`  
The second value is a celestial coordinate, it contains 3 obejcts:
* location, a Vec3I, containing a system coordinate
* planet, a size_t, containing the index of the planet you are flying to
* satelite, a size_t, containing the index of the satelite of the planet you are flying to, 0 is the planet itself

```lua
[
    "coordinate",
    [
        location = [-323300803, -646224704, 96068114],
        planet = 1,
        satelite = 0
    ]
]
```

---  
#### A celestial body's uuid  
The first element is a string with the value of `"object"`  
The second element is a string containing the object's uuid  
```lua
["object", "11112222333344445555666677778888"]
```

--- 

#### A position in space

A Vec2F that contains a position in a system's space.

```lua
[188.308, -210.669]
```

RpcPromise.description: An asynchronous promise that is used for communication.

PlatformerAStar::PathFinder.description:
a Lua UserData value which can be used for pathfinding over multiple frames. The `PathFinder` returned has the following two methods:

##### `bool` explore([`int` nodeLimit])

Explores the path up to the specified node count limit. Returns `true` if the pathfinding is complete and `false` if it is still incomplete. If nodeLimit is unspecified, this will search up to the configured maximum number of nodes, making it equivalent to world.platformerPathStart.

##### `PlatformerAStar::Path` result()

Returns the completed path.

explore.description: Explores the path up to the specified node count limit. Returns `true` if the pathfinding is complete and `false` if it is still incomplete. If nodeLimit is unspecified, this will search up to the configured maximum number of nodes, making it equivalent to world.platformerPathStart.

Returns a random unsigned integer value between minOrMax and max, or between 0 and minOrMax if no max is specified.
Returns a random signed integer value between minOrMax and max, or between 0 and minOrMax if no max is specified.

string.description: This library provides generic functions for string manipulation, such as finding and extracting substrings, and pattern matching. When indexing a string in Lua, the first character is at position 1 (not at 0, as in C). Indices are allowed to be negative and are interpreted as indexing backwards, from the end of the string. Thus, the last character is at position -1, and so on.

byte.description: Returns the internal numeric codes of the characters s[i], s[i+1], ..., s[j]. The default value for i is 1; the default value for j is i. These indices are corrected following the same rules of function string.sub.

find.description: Looks for the first match of pattern (see §6.4.1) in the string s. If it finds a match, then find returns the indices of s where this occurrence starts and ends; otherwise, it returns nil. A third, optional numeric argument init specifies where to start the search; its default value is 1 and can be negative. A value of true as a fourth, optional argument plain turns off the pattern matching facilities, so the function does a plain "find substring" operation, with no characters in pattern being considered magic. Note that if plain is given, then init must be given as well.

gmatch.description: Returns an iterator function that, each time it is called, returns the next captures from pattern (see §6.4.1) over the string s. If pattern specifies no captures, then the whole match is produced in each call.

gsub.description: Returns a copy of s in which all (or the first n, if given) occurrences of the pattern (see §6.4.1) have been replaced by a replacement string specified by repl, which can be a string, a table, or a function. gsub also returns, as its second value, the total number of matches that occurred. The name gsub comes from Global SUBstitution.

len.description: Receives a string and returns its length. The empty string "" has length 0. Embedded zeros are counted, so "a\000bc\000" has length 5.

lower.description: Receives a string and returns a copy of this string with all uppercase letters changed to lowercase. All other characters are left unchanged. The definition of what an uppercase letter is depends on the current locale.

match.description: Looks for the first match of pattern (see §6.4.1) in the string s. If it finds one, then match returns the captures from the pattern; otherwise it returns nil. If pattern specifies no captures, then the whole match is returned. A third, optional numeric argument init specifies where to start the search; its default value is 1 and can be negative.

rep.description: repeats the string a specific number of times. string will be empty if count is negative.

reverse.description: Reverse the characters in the string.

sub.description: Returns the substring of s that starts at i and continues until j; i and j can be negative. If j is absent, then it is assumed to be equal to -1 (which is the same as the string length). In particular, the call string.sub(s,1,j) returns a prefix of s with length j, and string.sub(s, -i) returns a suffix of s with length i.

upper.description: Receives a string and returns a copy of this string with all lowercase letters changed to uppercase. All other characters are left unchanged. The definition of what a lowercase letter is depends on the current locale.

function.description: A function stored into a variable.
